title: Sheet-Pan Lentil with Courgette & Potatoes
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Toss courgette (if using) and potatoes with 1 tbsp oil, salt and pepper on a baking tray.
Roast for 15 minutes.
Add lentil seasoned with herbs; roast 12–18 minutes until cooked through (thickest part 74°C for poultry, opaque for fish).
Rest 5 minutes and serve.

title: Greek Yogurt Bowl with Raspberries
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Assemble bowl/toast: base (yogurt/toast), toppings (fruit/veg), nuts/seeds.
Drizzle honey or sauce if using and serve.

title: Stuffed Pitas with Prawn
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Warm wrap/pita if desired.
Spread hummus/sauce, add prawn and veg.
Roll or fold tightly and slice.

title: Paneer Stir-Fry with Green Beans
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a wok over high heat.
Add paneer and stir-fry 3–5 minutes; remove.
Stir-fry green beans 2–3 minutes.
Return protein, add sauce; toss 1–2 minutes until glossy.
Serve with rice or noodles.

title: Cottage Cheese Toast with Pear
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Assemble bowl/toast: base (yogurt/toast), toppings (fruit/veg), nuts/seeds.
Drizzle honey or sauce if using and serve.

title: Soba Noodle Salad with Broccoli
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Cook grains (rice/quinoa) per packet; cool slightly.
Roast or pan-cook broccoli at 200°C for 15–18 minutes or until tender.
Cook or drain beef as required.
Assemble bowl with grains, protein, veg and dressing.

title: Tofu Grain Bowl with Kale
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Cook grains (rice/quinoa) per packet; cool slightly.
Roast or pan-cook kale at 200°C for 15–18 minutes or until tender.
Cook or drain tofu as required.
Assemble bowl with grains, protein, veg and dressing.

title: Energy Balls (Oats & Peanut Butter)
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Assemble and serve.

title: Basque Paneer al Pil-Pil
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Warm olive oil in a pan on low; add sliced garlic (and chilli).
Pan-sear paneer 3–4 min each side until opaque.
Spoon infused oil over fish; rest and serve.

title: Paneer Stir-Fry with Tomato
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a wok over high heat.
Add paneer and stir-fry 3–5 minutes; remove.
Stir-fry tomato 2–3 minutes.
Return protein, add sauce; toss 1–2 minutes until glossy.
Serve with rice or noodles.

title: Thai Green Chickpea Curry
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pot over medium heat.
Sauté onion 4–5 minutes until soft.
Add curry paste/spices; cook 1 minute.
Stir in coconut milk/stock and spinach ; simmer 10–12 minutes.
Add chickpea and simmer 8–10 minutes until cooked.
Season and serve with rice.
swaps: Dairy-free? Use coconut yogurt or omit dairy.

title: Thai Green Pork Curry
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pot over medium heat.
Sauté onion 4–5 minutes until soft.
Add curry paste/spices; cook 1 minute.
Stir in coconut milk/stock and courgette ; simmer 10–12 minutes.
Add pork and simmer 8–10 minutes until cooked.
Season and serve with rice.
swaps: Dairy-free? Use coconut yogurt or omit dairy.

title: Beef Stir-Fry with Green Beans
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a wok over high heat.
Add beef and stir-fry 3–5 minutes; remove.
Stir-fry green beans 2–3 minutes.
Return protein, add sauce; toss 1–2 minutes until glossy.
Serve with rice or noodles.

title: Shakshuka
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Sauté onion and pepper in 1 tbsp oil 5–6 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin and paprika; cook 1 minute.
Add tinned tomatoes; simmer 8–10 minutes to thicken.
Make wells, crack in eggs; lid on 5–7 minutes until set.

title: Yogurt with Honey & Walnuts
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Assemble and serve.

title: Hummus & Crudités
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Assemble and serve.

title: Pork Wrap with Hummus
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Warm wrap/pita if desired.
Spread hummus/sauce, add pork and veg.
Roll or fold tightly and slice.

title: Chicken Tacos
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Heat 1 tsp oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
Season and cook chicken 6–8 minutes until done.
Warm tortillas; fill with protein, salsa and veg.
Serve with lime wedges.
swaps: Vegetarian? Use firm tofu or chickpeas.

title: Spaghetti Turkey Bolognese
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan over medium heat.
Sauté onion and carrot 5 minutes.
Add turkey mince; brown 5–7 minutes.
Stir in tinned tomatoes and 200 ml stock; simmer 15–20 minutes.
Cook spaghetti in salted water; combine and serve.

title: Quinoa & Roasted Kale Salad
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Cook grains (rice/quinoa) per packet; cool slightly.
Roast or pan-cook kale at 200°C for 15–18 minutes or until tender.
Cook or drain lentil as required.
Assemble bowl with grains, protein, veg and dressing.

title: Sheet-Pan Chicken with Kale & Potatoes
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Toss kale (if using) and potatoes with 1 tbsp oil, salt and pepper on a baking tray.
Roast for 15 minutes.
Add chicken seasoned with herbs; roast 12–18 minutes until cooked through (thickest part 74°C for poultry, opaque for fish).
Rest 5 minutes and serve.
swaps: Vegetarian? Use firm tofu or chickpeas.

title: Protein Blueberry Muffins
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Mix wet and dry ingredients to a thick batter.
Spoon into lined tray; bake 18–22 minutes until set.
Cool on a rack.

title: Chickpea Grain Bowl with Spinach
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Cook grains (rice/quinoa) per packet; cool slightly.

title: Paella Salad Box
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Cook grains (rice/quinoa) per packet; cool slightly.
Roast or pan-cook green beans at 200°C for 15–18 minutes or until tender.
Cook or drain tofu as required.
Assemble bowl with grains, protein, veg and dressing.

title: Spanish Tortilla with Green Beans
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Cook thinly sliced potatoes and onion 10–12 minutes until tender.
Add peppers; cook 3–4 minutes.
Pour in beaten eggs; cook gently 5–7 minutes, flip or grill to set the top.
Rest 5 minutes; slice to serve.
swaps: Gluten-free? Use GF pasta or corn tortillas.

title: Scrambled Eggs with Mushrooms
hydrationTip: Have 300–500 ml water with this meal; add more around training days.
method: Assemble bowl/toast: base (yogurt/toast), toppings (fruit/veg), nuts/seeds.
